titleStmt.title: Hexapla, that is, A six-fold commentarie vpon the most diuine Epistle of the holy apostle S. Paul to the Romanes wherein according to the authors former method, sixe things are obserued in euery chapter ... : wherein are handled the greatest points of Christian religion ... : diuided into two bookes ...
titleStmt.author: Willet, Andrew, 1562-1621.

titleStmt.title: Hexapla, that is, A six-fold commentarie vpon the most diuine Epistle of the holy apostle S. Paul to the Romanes wherein according to the authors former method, sixe things are obserued in euery chapter ... : wherein are handled the greatest points of Christian religion ... : diuided into two bookes ...
titleStmt.author: Willet, Andrew, 1562-1621.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Cantrell Legge, printer to the Vniuersitie of Cambridge,

notesStmt.note: Two v. in one, paged continuously. Vol. 2 has special t.p. with title: The second booke of this commentarie vpon the second generall part of the Epistle contained in the five last chapters ...
Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library.
